story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: How to Turn GitHub into a To-Do List
caption: lifehacker.com
description: I'm a huge fan of to-do lists. They help me stay organized, prioritize my day, and add structure to an otherwise chaotic schedule. I recently discovered what appears to be the best yet simplest way to keep a to-do list: a GitHub Gist.

data.message: Even though I wouldn't use it (because Trello #AllTheThings), but I still love this approach.  Very nice way of maintaining tasks by hand (except you don't to), and I also love that ticks are saved in preview mode in Github Markdown.
I use Trello too. it's exactly what every one needs to organize his tasks and todo-list!
Thanks guys for mentioning "Trello". I gave it a try, that is exactly what i was looking for.
Folks, I tried trello for a while, but you've got to try Wunderlist for more simple stuff (tasks with only two states, say just to-do and done). It also have nice Android App
I used Wunderlist long time ago but can you tag people in Todos?

Trello scales up and down very well for me. The simplest thing is just-title cards moving between 2 lists, all the way to working with team, checklists,  and labeling and getting notifications and all the complex stuff...
I also use the Android app for my personal board (I call it Personal Kanban, so that I feel smart and organised :D). Historically it wasn't the best ever but it has evolved a lot in recent months.
Sorry for the pretty late reply. Yes you can tag people, but I think there's somesort of a daily limit :D
